revised_title: Investigations into the Movements of Liquid Metals and Electrolytes in the Voltaic Circuit
tldr: The author examines the movements of liquid metals and electrolytes in the voltaic circuit and determines that both substances must be in a liquid state and one must be a metallic conductor of electricity. The study investigates various metals and alloys to understand if this property is general, concluding that it is a common characteristic of metals and alloys in a liquid state.
